intro: Impatiens justicioides, commonly known as the scarlet ice plant, is a species native to Central and South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Balsaminaceae, characterized by its delicate, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are typically pink or red with five petals. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
